googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsSdr: You must show proof of where you live to register to vote. Documents must have your name and current address. You can show a digital copy of any document. Acceptable documents include: Michigan driver’s license or State ID card; Current utility bill; Bank statement; Paycheck or government check; Other government document
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfBox6: Enter your Michigan driver's license number or the last 4 digits of your social security number. If you don't have any of these numbers, enter "NONE" in this space.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.vbmAbsenteeBallotRules:
* For the November 3, 2020 election, every registered voter will receive an **absentee ballot application** in the mail.
* Any registered Michigan voter can request an absentee ballot and vote by mail.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfSubmissionAddress:
Michigan Department of State  
Bureau of Elections  
P.O. Box 20126  
Lansing, MI 48901‐0726
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsInPersonVoting: All Michigan voters must show a non-expired photo ID issued by any US state or the federal government.  Acceptable forms of photo a driver's license or state ID card issued by any state; a US passport; a US military ID; a tribal ID; or an employee ID issued by any state or federal agency.  You can also show   a student ID from any high school, college, or university.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.vbmWarnings: Your local election office will compare your signature on your voted ballot to the one on your driver’s license. If the signatures don't match, your ballot might be rejected. Please sign carefully.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.year2020LegalChanges:
* Due to COVID-19, Michigan will not require an excuse to vote by mail in 2020.
*	For the November 3, 2020 election, every registered voter will receive an **absentee ballot application** in the mail.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsOvr: If you have a Michigan driver's license or state ID card, you can register to vote online. If you don't, you can still register to vote by mail.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsVbm: Michigan voters do not have to provide ID with an absentee ballot application.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationRules:
To register in Michigan you must:

  * be a citizen of the United States
  * be 18 years old by the next election
  * be a resident of Michigan and at least a 30 day resident of your city or township by Election Day
  * not be confined in a jail after being convicted and sentenced

**Warning:** Michigan law requires that the same address be used for voter
registration and driver license purposes. Therefore, if the residence address
you provide on this form differs from the address shown on a driver license or
personal identification card issued by the State of Michigan, the Secretary of
State will automatically change your driver license or personal identification
card address to match the residence address entered on this form. If an
address change is made, the Secretary of State will mail you an address update
sticker for your driver license or personal identification card.
